SEARCH
Package src

Class Accounts

java.lang.Object
src.Accounts
public class Accounts extends Object
This class is used to store all relevant information related to accounts.

Accounts data is stored in the accountsdata.json file.

Account registration and login are handled by the registerAccount(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) and login(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) methods respectively.

A variety of getter and setter methods are also provided to obtain and modify account information.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ho Lun (Geoffrey) Kong

  • Constructor Details

    • Accounts

      public Accounts()
      Constructor will either create a new accounts file or read in an existing one. If the file accountsdata.json does not exist, the constructor will create an empty JSONArray and store it within the file. If the file accountsdata.json does exist, the constructor will read the data in the file and load the list of accounts into the accounts instance variable.

  • Method Details

    • registerAccount

      public boolean registerAccount(String username, String password)
      Method registers users for an account, and updates the accounts file and the currently logged in user.
      Parameters:
      username - the username the user wishes to register under
      password - the password the user wishes to use for their account
      Returns:
      true if account was successfully registered, false if the account already exists
      See Also:
      • accountExists(java.lang.String)
      • updateAccountsFile(org.json.simple.JSONObject)
      • getAccountData(java.lang.String)
      • LevelProgress

    • login

      public boolean login(String username, String password)
      Method logs user into their existing account, and updates the currently logged in user.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for the account the user wishes to login as
      password - the password the for the user account the user wishes to login as
      Returns:
      true if the login was sucessful, false if the login was unsuccessful because either the login or password is incorrect
      See Also:
      • accountExists(java.lang.String)
      • getAccountData(java.lang.String)
      • correctPassword(java.lang.String,java.lang.String)

    • correctPassword

      public boolean correctPassword(String username, String password)
      Method indicates whether a specified username and password combination is valid.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check credential validity for
      password - the password to check credential validity for
      Returns:
      true if the credential pair is valid, false otherwise

    • accountExists

      public boolean accountExists(String username)
      Method checks if an account exists in the account data file.
      Parameters:
      username - the username to check account existence for
      Returns:
      true if the account exists in the data file, false otherwise

    • getAccounts

      public org.json.simple.JSONArray getAccounts()
      Method returns the instance variable representation of all account data.
      Returns:
      a JSONArray that represents all accounts and their data

    • getCurrentAccount

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject getCurrentAccount()
      Method returns the instance variable representation of the current logged in account's data.
      Returns:
      a JSONObject that represents the currently logged in account's data

    • getAccountData

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject getAccountData(String username)
      Method returns the data of a specific account from the data file.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account to obtain the data for
      Returns:
      a JSONObject that represents the desired account to obtain the data for

    • getProgress

      public org.json.simple.JSONArray getProgress(org.json.simple.JSONObject account)
      Method returns level progress for a specific account.
      Parameters:
      account - the account to obtain the progress from
      Returns:
      a JSONArray that contains the progress for a user
      See Also:
      • LevelProgress

    • updateUserProgress

      public void updateUserProgress(String username, org.json.simple.JSONArray progress)
      Method updates a specific account's progress and writes the updated account data to the data file.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the account to update the data for
      progress - the progress to add to the account

    • logout

      public void logout()
      Method logs out a user and sets the currently logged in user instance variable to null.

    • getPlayerScore

      public PlayerScore getPlayerScore(String username)
      Retrieves a player's score based on their username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose score is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The PlayerScore object containing the player's username and score.
